nickvision

  • deliverable: process book & interactive prototype
  • role: graphic design & ux design
  • problem: what product can add value to the nickelodeon brand?
  • methods: conversation generation, whiteboarding, sketching, round table brainstorming
  • artifacts: process book, slideshow deck (pdf, non-interactive)

Solution:

In the span of about 8 weeks, we came up with Nickvision, an augmented reality pitch for the Nickelodeon brand. I primarily worked on the user interface and user experience (product); I also designed the booklet seen here. Our team, Nick Kids on the Block, presented our work to a room of managers, directors, and executives from across Viacom. It was a challenging process; as a team member, I needed to collaborate with really smart people who often saw things from a different perspective. As a designer, however, I needed to learn how to work within a brand while responding to important feedback from users, peers, and stakeholders.
